meanings.definition: The simultaneous perception of two images of a single object.
meanings.sent1: She experienced diplopia when looking at the clock.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed her diplopia as a result of eye muscle weakness.
meanings.sent3: During the magic show, the magician created diplopia by using mirrors.
meanings.sent4: The diplopia of reality and illusion blurred together in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The diplopia made it seem like there were two clocks on the wall.

meanings.sent1: His diplopia made it hard to focus on the road while driving.
meanings.sent2: The diplopia in his left eye cleared up after wearing an eye patch.
meanings.sent3: The diplopia caused him to see two moons in the night sky.
meanings.sent4: Her diplopia of the landscape gave her a unique perspective on the scenery.
meanings.sent5: The diplopia of the streetlights created a beautiful but confusing sight.
